From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

German

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Middle High German zwīc, from Old High German zwīg, from Proto-Germanic *twīgą. Cognate with Dutch twijg, English twig. Compare the latter for more.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /tsvaɪ̯k/, [t͡sʋaɪ̯k] (standard)
  • IPA(key): /tsvaɪ̯ç/ (northern and central Germany; chiefly colloquial)
  • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)
  • Hyphenation: Zweig

Noun

[edit]

Zweig m (strong, genitive Zweiges or Zweigs, plural Zweige, diminutive Zweigchen n or Zweiglein n or Zweigerl n)

  1. branch, twig
  2. (figurative) branch; section

Declension

[edit]
Declension of Zweig [masculine, strong]
singular plural
indef. def. noun def. noun
nominative ein der Zweig die Zweige
genitive eines des Zweiges, Zweigs der Zweige
dative einem dem Zweig, Zweige1 den Zweigen
accusative einen den Zweig die Zweige

1Now rare, see notes.

Synonyms

[edit]
  • (figuratively): Branche, Sektor

Holonyms

[edit]
  • (branch, twig): Baum
